body_html: If you are using tf.estimator.Estimator, which I think is the current best way to go (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46925196/does-tf-estimator-estimator-train-maintain-input-fn-state), you can pass a different input_fn for train and evaluate, and you can use the mode passed to model_fn to create the appropriate graph.
body_text: If you are using tf.estimator.Estimator, which I think is the current best way to go (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46925196/does-tf-estimator-estimator-train-maintain-input-fn-state), you can pass a different input_fn for train and evaluate, and you can use the mode passed to model_fn to create the appropriate graph.
body: If you are using tf.estimator.Estimator, which I think is the current best way to go (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46925196/does-tf-estimator-estimator-train-maintain-input-fn-state), you can pass a different input_fn for train and evaluate, and you can use the mode passed to model_fn to create the appropriate graph.
